Close
difficulty breathing/had a very difficult time breathing; fast heart rate/rapid heart rate; contraction in the chest near the heart or the abdomen; some muscle tightness/tightness in the chest that was muscle tightness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's wife) reported for a patient. This is the first case out of two cases. A 47-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number: EW0187, Expiration date: unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, administered at an unspecified anatomical location on 19Jun2021 in the evening (age at vaccination was 47 years) as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. The patient did not have any medical history. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccination. The reporter stated that she was calling because her husband and she went to the (Facility Address), yesterday at 1 O' Clock and got a shot for COVID and she had 2 side effects but she was okay, her husband had some side effects that were not really listed here under severe or more common side effects. On 19Jun2021 at 21:30 pm, last night the patient had tightness in the chest that was muscle tightness difficulty breathing and a rapid heart rate. They give them a paper work after getting the shot which listed some common side effects but not all possible side effects. It just listed few of the severe ones and then some common less severe side effect but it did not mention anything about some muscle tightness, contraction in the chest near the heart or the abdomen and difficulty breathing and a fast heart rate which was what her husband had been experiencing since last night had a very difficult time breathing but he was not allergic, he was not swelling, he didn't have a rash. The reporter confirmed that it was Pfizer COVID 19 Vaccine. No treatment was received for the adverse events. The reporter stated that it has not been resolved and it was still persisting the last time he had checked his heart rate because he was a runner and right now its 101 that was the resting heart which was high for him he normally had very low heart rate like 67 it was 136 about 20 minutes ago, it was raising without exercising. The reporter was informed about the Pfizer Medical Information. The reporter was also advised to visit nearby healthcare profession in the case of emergency. This case LRN W2021388441 was cross linked with LRN W2021388442. The outcome of the event fast heart rate/rapid heart rate was not resolved. The outcome of the other events was unknown. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

hoarse voice, throat tightness Narrative: Patient received his 1st COVID shot 3/11/21. Ten minutes later he developed intense itching, a horse voice, and felt itching in his throat stating " I feel like my throat was getting tight". Denied any prior similar reaction except for pruritus from opiates. Admitted to ER. IV Diphenhydramine and dexamethasone were administered with 1L of normal saline. Observed for 2 hours and discharged as symptoms resolved, no longer flushed, and voice returned to normal. 48 2021-03-28 respiratory arrest After receiving the 1st dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine, the patient moved to the observation area. ... Read more
Close
After receiving the 1st dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine, the patient moved to the observation area. After 5 min, patient reported feeling light-headed and tried to stand up. The patient sat down on the floor and leaned against the wall. Patient was able to stand and walk to the provider room for closer observation. Patient felt hot and looked pale. The provider placed a blood pressure cuff on the patient, at which point the patient slumped forward and stopped breathing. A carotid pulse was not able to be appreciated. The patient was pulled to the floor, positioned airway open and was given oxygen. BP was 96/40. Blood sugar was checked (104) and the AED pads were placed. EMS was called. AED advised no shock, patient had a pulse and was breathing. Patient gradually became alert, though reported not feeling well. Patient was disoriented and was not aware of passing out nor the current event. Repeat BP 115/50. Patient began vomiting (~300-400 mL). Patient left with EMS to be evaluated at local Emergency Department. Of note, patient reports history of vasovagal syncope events 2/2 to various situations.

48 2021-04-26 collapsed lung, wheezing Please note that I am the patient in question here, but also an physician, so I will write this in t... Read more
Close
Please note that I am the patient in question here, but also an physician, so I will write this in technical terms as best as I understand what happened. For background, my cardiac history is important. I had a work-up for palpitations performed more than a year ago that revealed normal cardiac function (EF > 65% by NM myocardial perfusion study), normal coronary arteries, and significant exercise tolerance (I maxed out the treadmill test). Usuallly I have to engage in vigorous exercise to raise my heart rate > 160 bpm. My resting heart rate is typically in the 50s or less. On Jan 15, 2021 I had an elective cerebral angiography and embolization procedure performed. I was asymptomatic prior to this procedure. The procedure requires general anesthesia for several hours. I have had the procedure conducted a few months previously and it typically has an unremarkable recovery, one night required in the hospital. After the procedure and following extubation, I had hypoxia on room air, tachycardia, wheezing and fatigue. The working cause for this was suspected atelectasis due to general anesthesia and I was given bronchodilators. While my breathing improved overnight, I was very tachycardic even while sleeping ? pulse greater than 130. Overnight telemetry noted arrhythmias with sinus tachycardia. The tachycardia persisted long after prior albuterol use so I had CTA chest on 1/16. No PTE was noted, though some basilar atelectasis and mild upper lobe ground glass opacities. I was discharged but due to continued mild hypoxia overnight, low grade fever (< 101F), and persistent tachycardia with any movement, I went to the ED on 1/17 for additional evaluation. In the ED, I had tachycardia with arrhythmias noted (rate up to 160). Sinoatrial exit block noted on EKG and telemetry. COVID-19 testing was negative by nasopharyngeal PCR and antigen testing. Resting heart rate was > 90 even when sleeping. Follow-up echocardiogram on 1/21/21 revealed depressed ejection fraction (40-45%). Cardia MRI on 2/1 was performed to evaluate for cardiomyopathy. Symptoms at this point were fatigue, dyspnea with even mild activity (e.g. walking), and tachycardia > 140 bpm with even just walking. My resting heart rate improved to 40s-50s. It showed normal wall motion and ventricle size with slightly reduced ejection fraction. Cardiology recommended cardiac event monitoring which I wore for 28 days. It only revealed sinus tachycardia and bradycardia. I still don?t feel great but able to do more physically than a couple of months ago. I await further f/u cardiac imaging to see if there has been improvement in the heart function.

Close
Patient is a 48-year-old male with patient history significant for CAD, CHF, ICD, HTN, hyperlipidemia, and smoking who presented to the ED yesterday morning with 1 day history of chest pain. Patient described the CP as moderate aching in the substernal area that did not radiate. The pain was intermittent, with each episode lasting 1-2 minutes. The CP was associated with LUE numbness and SOB on exertion. The chest pain and LUE numbness have now resolved. Patient also reports a three week history of RUE swelling. The swelling gradually worsened and is now associated with pain and proximal RUE bruising. RUE pain is rated 5/10. In the ED, patient was found to have NSTEMI and small right lower lobe segmental pulmonary artery embolus. Venous Doppler was positive for occlusive thrombosis in the R subclavian, basilic, and cephalic veins. Patient was started on IV heparin. Patient is scheduled for cardiac cath today. Hematology is consulted regarding PE and RUE DVT. Patient denies personal or family history of blood clots or recent travel. Reports receiving COVID vaccine in LUE approximately three weeks ago. Also admits to being more sedentary recently due to being unemployed. Denies nausea, vomiting, bleeding, bowel changes, fever, or chills. 48 2021-05-14 throat tightness I felt fine after the shot, but two hours later, my throat felt like it was closing and it hurt in a... Read more
Close
I felt fine after the shot, but two hours later, my throat felt like it was closing and it hurt in a way I've never felt before. I had a bad migraine and my whole body was sore. My blood pressure was high for me at 143/94 with a heart rate of 94. I trend at 120/80 with a heart rate around 90. I take my blood pressure regularly to help manage Type II Diabetes. I was concerned with my throat, as the other symptoms seemed normal for the vaccine. It was very uncomfortable. I phoned the nurse line and was told to have someone bring me to the ER to check me out and take a Benadryl. I took the Benadryl and packed for the ER with meds and ID and my friend drove me. I was still uncomfortable enough to warrant wanting to go and had become very dizzy. When we got to the ER there was a wait and I went to my friend's car until called. After about 30 minutes (about 45 minutes after the Benadryl) my throat released and felt much better. My vitals were taken and seemed normal. The normal aches of the vaccine didn't concern me enough to stay, so I returned home. My symptoms remain what seem to be normal reactions to the vaccine: sore joints, slight headache, slightly sore throat, Charlie horse feeling at the injection site. Nothing of major concern. My largest worry was with the throat feeling closed, but it appears the Benadryl took care of it.

Close
On May 9th I began to experience severe pain in my back extending down my left side. The pain was severe enough to prevent sleeping that night. The pain continued throughout May 10th becoming worse with deep breaths or any type of internal strain (cough, sneeze, etc). That evening, I took two Tylenol and later two Ibuprofen and was able to sleep. The pain persisted for the next week, slowly improving but not fully going away. On May 15th I conducted a telemedicine appointment and was advised to go to either Urgent Care or the ER. I chose the ER at Hospital. A D-Dimer test showed elevated results and a CT scan was ordered. The CT revealed blood clots in my right lung, specifically "Subpleural conslidation in the posterior basilar segment the right lower lobe is present, compatible with pulmonary infarct. Question additional pulmonary infarct in the lateral basilar segment the lower right lobe. Probable atelectasis in the left lung base." MD prescribed Eliquis @ 10mg 2x daily and I was discharged with a referral to .

Stated that he had had shortness of breath and chest pain that started a few days after vaccine that never really got better. He was found to have pericardial effusion and pleural effusion of unclear etiology. Did not have evidence of myocarditis on EKG or imaging, but findings suspicious for pericarditis.

48 2021-06-09 shortness of breath Heart attack in right carotid artery. Severe chest pain, shortness of breath, clammy, sweat for abou... Read more

48 2021-06-13 shortness of breath I was playing ice hockey on April 10, 2021 when I started to experience shortness of breath. Coming... Read more
Close
I was playing ice hockey on April 10, 2021 when I started to experience shortness of breath. Coming to the bench between shifts is part of the game and that time on the bench is used to recover (both for your muscles and for your cardiovascular system). However, towards the latter part of the game, I continued to be short of breath even while sitting on the bench. Then in the last 10 minutes or so of the game, I fell to the ice for no reason. It was as if my muscles had just totally failed. I thought the shortness of breath may have been a sign of a Covid infection since I had not reached the 14 day period after my second shot. So I went to urgent care to get a Covid test. My test came back negative, but the doctor was concerned with my symptoms, so he took an x-ray of my heart and an ECG. He said that he noticed a blur around my heart, but didn't have any explanation. He thought I was in very good health, so he gave me a list of heart specialists to contact if I had another 'episode'. Fortunately, I did not have another episode. The only reason that I am submitting this incident is because I understand the administration is having an emergency meeting to review cases of an inflamed heart. I am not sure my situation was an inflamed, but I wanted to have my episode documented in case my situation was a temporary adverse reaction to the vaccine.

Patient had no reaction at time of vaccination; was monitored for 15 minutes prior to leaving clinic. This nurse was notified today by ER Physician that the patient came into the ER around 8pm (on the night of the same day that he received his vaccine in the early morning hours) with c/o shortness of breath. It was reported that the patient had taken nebulizer treatments at home with no relief. Symptoms began around 5:30pm. Patient ambulated into ER at time of visit but during the visit became unresponsive. Patient was intubated and coded with time of death called at 9:52pm. Patient has history of asthma.

Close
Phase 1. Injury (6 APR) Pain during Injection (tip of needle) and immediate flinch/twitch in heart area. Racing heart, Intensity of beat, Severe tinnitus left ear only, adrenaline, Can?t sleep; Symptoms worst when I get into bed Phase 2. (10 APR) Urgent Care Visit: Chest very weak, each day gets worse; inflammation left side of body (chest, hand, face), felt like hole in heart, shortness of breath, numb hand, easy to excite, pain when lean forward; heart out of rhythm; Phase 3: (13 APR) Nighttime rushed by wife to ER due to symptoms of a heart attack couldn?t breathe, numb hands, shivering, heart going berserk, dizzy, aggressive, heart out of rhythm. Did EKG and diagnosed with Arrhythmia and Palpitations Phase 4: 14 APR Condition Stabilizes with bed rest; heart speed and intensity reduces slightly, heart still out of rhythm; ringing in left ear continues; noticed left hand, face, chest all swollen, out of breath walking to mailbox; can?t breathe deeply; Chest begins to bubble, gargle, fizzle when I lay down. Palpitations in throat, legs, need to drink a lot water; can?t sleep due to heart racing then sore and breast bone enlarged; chest tenses up often. Phase 5: Visit to Cardiologist (26 APR) He mentions potential Nerve damage with injection and prescribes Ultrasound. Days later I have second ?ER like? Scare and confirm in my mind this also nerve related. Phase 6: Mid May Start Recovery: Chest still tenses up doing emails, phone, late at work; easily excited; Each night total relaxation; start to feel nerves twitching like electric pulses in left chest; Feels like Electric Pulses/Pain from injection site to location of original twitch in heart area. Lean forward pain/discomfort; Still very weak chest muscles that get painful and sore easily Phase 7: Early June: Ultrasound at Heart Dr. (2 JUN) looks better /normal size. Heartbeat steadier and quiet but palpitations persist (extra heart beats felt in my throat); Overall body feeling stronger but chest muscles still weak and sore after ultrasound experience. Ringing in the left ear is better and milder twitches in chest at night. Teeth sensitive to cold liquids and Numb hands while walking esp 4 June; tense chest at work/home and need to step away and breath; Heart faster; long time to calm after warm/hot bath Currently late June still suffer from muscle weakness especially left chest, left arm where shot went in. Hands are still numb and Heart races when in bed.. Chest also still freezes up during work. Have to focus on breathing calmly. Overall though my condition continues to improve.

48 year-old man referred for admission from outpatient echo appointment after finding of large pericardial effusion. Patient's history includes iron-deficiency anemia from hiatal hernia and season allergies. Was in usual state of health until received second Pfizer mRNA Covid-19 vaccine 5/18/21. Symptoms worsened and developed swelling of legs and abdomen, worse exertional dyspnea and had to sleep sitting up due to orthopnea. Had outpt echo as part of eval and sent to ED. Denies chest pain, palpitations, dizziness. Brain fog is improving. Mildly constipated. No black or bloody stools. No abd pain. 48 2021-07-25 shortness of breath After receiving the vaccine I had the occasional sore arm and pain at the vaccination site. The seco... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine I had the occasional sore arm and pain at the vaccination site. The second day after I started to feel my chest started to burn, which was accompanied by trouble breathing. It was a pain that I have never experienced before in my chest it felt tight and was burning very bad. I started to feel light headed as if I was going to faint while doing my normal daily activities. I decided to stop doing anything that caused my heart to beat too fast. So later on that night i decided to go to the ER, where they did an ekg and some blood work. They also did a scan of my chest where the doctor said everything came back and looked normal. Over time the pain and everything I was experiencing started to get better. I still have a hard time breathing every now and then. Also after the vaccine I experienced a slight cough and runny nose.

49 2021-01-03 shortness of breath On December 23, 2020 she had the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccination at 7:30 p.m. She then worked her shift ... Read more
Close
On December 23, 2020 she had the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccination at 7:30 p.m. She then worked her shift as a dialysis nurse and went home the following morning. She did not have any symptoms until 5:00 p.m. the following afternoon when she woke up. She developed itching of her back and a mild erythematous rash across her chest. That evening around 7:00 p.m. she noticed a rash on her arms that was itching. At 7:30 p.m. she had tightness in her chest and a nonproductive cough. She attributed the symptoms to her asthma. Her symptoms improved throughout the night. She went home on Christmas morning and went to bed. She woke up at around 5:00 p.m. She had swelling of her eyelids and an urticarial rash across her face and chest. She did have some mild throat itching. She reported to work at 7:00 p.m. but continued to have symptoms with increasing shortness of breath. She reported to the emergency department and was evaluated. She was given famotidine, Methylprednisolone, and hydroxyzine. She was also given ipratropium/albuterol nebulized. Her respiratory symptoms did improve, and she was discharged around midnight. She continued to have a slight erythematous rash that was present until she went to bed the following morning. When she woke up it had resolved.

3/25: Approx 5 mins after injection, started breathing quickly and became lightheaded. Moments later, heart rate elevated north of 190 bpm and blood pressure went up to approx 180/100. Both EKG and Bloodwork was indicated as normal. Released from hospital around 6P. Slept through most of the night. 3/26: heart rate was erratic all day. Would race and then stabilize throughout the day/night. Extremely lethargic. No trouble breathing (was able to breathe and take deep breathes) but took effort to breathe. 3/27: 1:40A woke up heart began racing at close to 200 bpm. Dry mouth, shakes. Similar to what I experienced immediately following the vaccine shot. Went to ER out of precaution. Symptoms stabilized after about an hour. Hospital did EKG, blood work and chest X-ray. all were normal, lungs were clear. However, glucose and bilirubin were both slightly elevated. 3/29: Still feeling lethargic. Heart rate has stabilized some but is still erratic. It easily increases from simply walking around the house (much more than usual). 3/30: Scheduled appointment with primary care physician 3/31: Scheduled appointment with cardialogist

49 2021-04-18 very rapid breathing, shortness of breath The evening of the shot my body basically turned on itself and began an all out mission to rid the v... Read more
Close
The evening of the shot my body basically turned on itself and began an all out mission to rid the vaccine. Of course, that couldn't happen, but my body was going to proceed until I was dead or recovering. I began having severe chills, roasting heat flashes, headache, and body ache. Every sweat gland turned on full blast and did not turn off. I began to vomit in outrageous fashion. As violent as I've ever experienced. I had "sessions" of vomiting at least thirty times from Thurs night to Monday afternoon. When I could get out of the bathroom, I would collapse back into my sweat soaked bed. I would have an awful time trying to catch my breath. It would be up to ten minutes of hyperventilating and racing pulse, until it would suddenly normalize. And then I'd be utterly exhausted and slip into some kind of semi-sleep coma. This would not last even an hour before I'd be racing to the bathroom again. This was the first sixty hours. Vomit. Hyperventilate. Wish for death. Sleep coma. Repeat. About 24 hrs in I added severe diarrhea that was a part of every bathroom journey from then on. Ate nothing. Couldn't take normal meds. Sipped some pedialite. Late Sunday I turned a corner and felt like I wouldn't die. Took a full seven days for me to get any energy back and feel human again.- Every single symptom besides headache, was the worst I've ever experienced.

Experience two large heart palpitations and what seemed stopped beating for a second, this was followed by tremendous pressure in my head, I thought I was experiencing a stroke. I felt like I was going to black out and was having tightness in my chest , my wife took me to the E.R. I had an EKG done and it not show any arrhythmia and CT scan of my head did not show any abnormality. They scheduled me to follow up with cardiologist. The whole week I experienced the following symptoms: Tightness and sharp pains in chest; Difficulty breathing, especially at night (had to sleep sitting up on couch one night and another night woke up with difficulty breathing , appeared to be the biggest problem when laying flat). Would get out of breath walking up stairs; Moments I would get really light headed with a feeling like I could pass out; Symptoms last until the 4/16 , when they finally went away. Follow up with Cardiologist, who scheduled an electrocardiogram and stress tests on 5/7. The tests results showed that I had a healthy heart and no underlying conditions. I'm 49 and never have experienced any cardiac events. before or have a family history of cardiac disease. I have no known allergies either.
49 2021-05-09 shortness of breath Fatigue, body aches, headache, sore throat, sinus pressure, vomiting, shortness of breath
49 2021-05-09 respiratory arrest He felt very bad the night he received the 2nd shot of Pfizer covid-19 vaccine on April 27. He even ... Read more
Close
He felt very bad the night he received the 2nd shot of Pfizer covid-19 vaccine on April 27. He even joked he probably would die that night. He also complained that despite his protest, the person who administered the shot insisted to inject on his shoulder joint. He developed a bigger-than-quarter-size bruise on his right inner arm the next day. He was feeling tired the following days. On May 4 around 3:30, I heard he was making loud noises. I came to his side immediately. At the time I thought he was making louder than usual snores. I nudged him gently but he didn't respond. After about 15 seconds, the sound stopped, and he had no breath. I then called 911 within 10 seconds, tried to do CPR on him. It took EMS 6 minutes to arrive even though we live very close to a fire station in a well-accessed urban area. EMS worked on him for about 30 minutes before transported him to hospital. They continued to work on him for a while. He never regained breath.
49 2021-05-20 shortness of breath Patient readmitted on 5/19 who was just discharged on 5/15. Patient initially presented with fever, ... Read more
Close
Patient readmitted on 5/19 who was just discharged on 5/15. Patient initially presented with fever, SOB, lymphadenopathy, diffuse maculopapular rash. He had his first dose of COVID vaccine (Pfizer) on 4/23, and his symptoms began on 4/29. He was itchy all over, but when he developed fever and SOB he came to the ER on 5/2 and was discharged on prednisone. His symptoms continued and so he came back to the ER and was admitted. He had a lymph node biopsy to rule out lymphoma (pathology returned negative for lymphoma). He was treated empirically with ceftriaxone and doxycycline. He tested + for EBV IGG but not IGM. EBV PCR was pending upon discharge. He had a borderline positive lyme serology. He was discharged on doxycycline and steroids with improved symptoms. He returned to the ER with again worsening SOB, night sweats, worsening rash, recurrence of fever. He denies sore throat or any sick contacts. He reports a normal appetite. He was found to be hypotensive and in AKI.
49 2021-05-22 respiratory failure, shortness of breath Post vaccine #2 on 5/18 he developed hives, shortness of breath and reportedly did not feel with fat... Read more
Close
Post vaccine #2 on 5/18 he developed hives, shortness of breath and reportedly did not feel with fatigue. Symptoms worsened and he was admitted to ICU on May 21st via the ED for multiorgan failure including respiratory failure with R pneumonia, Shock, Renal failure, Disseminated intravascular coagulation, shock liver failure requiring invasive vent support and treatment for septic shock including vasopressor support and antibiotic therapy. He was started on CRRT on the 22nd. His INR continues to rise and Hb dropping consistent with worsening DIC. Blood cultures are positive for MRSA. He will likely die from progressive septic shock and MSOF.
49 2021-05-27 shortness of breath Pt presented with complaint of mild SOB. Pt denied CP. Full assessment performed and V/S obtained. P... Read more
Close
Pt presented with complaint of mild SOB. Pt denied CP. Full assessment performed and V/S obtained. Pt denied any significant PMH. (+)breath sounds and equal bilaterally, (-)stridor noted. Pt stated that he felt as though it may have been an anxiety reaction. Pt rested in observation area x10 mins. At conclusion of time, pt noted relief of symptoms. Pt stated that he did not want to go to the hospital. Pt informed of risks of refusing, up to and including death. Pt accepted risks and stated he would follow-up with his PCP. Pt signed AMA and released without incident.

Close
50-year-old male status post heart transplant on 02/08/2017. He developed antibody mediated rejection in June, 2020. He received multiple sessions of plasmapheresis and IVIG. Last echocardiogram in March 2021 revealed normal LV systolic function with an EF of 60%. He presented to the ED on 6/10 with cough and dyspnea. Labs revealed lymphopenia, neutropenia, and leukopenia and tested positive for COVID. He is s/p Pfizer vaccination on 2/22 and 3/15. He received casirivimab, imdevimab on admission. Before this admission, he was taking tacrolimus 4/3.5 mg twice daily, Rapamune 1.5 mg daily, MMF 1000 mg twice daily, and prednisone 5 mg daily.

Nausea; Fever; Fatigue; Chest pain; Difficulty breathing; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 49-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection, #lot: Er2613) via an unspecified route of administration administered in Arm Right on 24Mar2021 and second dose (#lot: Er8629) via an unspecified route of administration administered in Arm Right on 14Apr2021 as single dose (at the age of 49-years-old) for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced nausea, fever, fatigue, chest pain and difficulty breathing on an unspecified date. The patient did not report this because he didn't think it was relevant until recent media about myocarditis. He was close 3x to dialing 911 thought was having heart attack. The outcome of all the events was unknown. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.
49 2021-07-01 shortness of breath 49yom with PMH HTN presents with CP and SOB. Ddx includes but is not limited to: ACS, PE, PNA, aorti... Read more
Close
49yom with PMH HTN presents with CP and SOB. Ddx includes but is not limited to: ACS, PE, PNA, aortic dissection, pericarditis, myocarditis. On arrival, patient appeared critically ill with cool, clammy skin, diaphoretic, complaining of chest pain. Patient initially able to answer simple questions, however quickly became unconscious, witnessed having tonic colonic seizure activity. Patient given 2 mg of lorazepam which aborted the seizure, however he remained unresponsive. IV fluids were started, and patient remained hypotensive after 3 L of fluids. Bedside cardiac ultrasound was performed which showed a large pericardial effusion with tamponade physiology. We continued fluid resuscitation and patient was intubated, while stat Cardiology consult was called. Patient suffered a cardiac arrest shortly after intubation. Cardiology performed emergent pericardiocentesis at the bedside which showed hemopericardium with output of greater than 500 mL of blood. ROSC was achieved following pericardiocentesis, and we continued resuscitative measures. Emergent arterial line and central venous lines were placed. Patient began to have profuse bleeding from all orifices, and massive transfusion protocol was initiated. Patient was stabilized enough to be taken to CT scanner which showed an extensive aortic dissection extending into the RCA, abdominal aorta, brachiocephalic artery, common carotids, and into the abdominopelvic vasculature. Cardiac and vascular surgery were consulted stat, and the decision was made to take the patient emergently to the OR. We were informed shortly after that the patient had expired en route to the operating room and they were unable to obtain ROSC. Final impression: type A aortic dissection, cardiac tamponade. Second dose of mRNA vaccine (unknown if Pfizer or Moderna) received two days prior to event.

49 2021-07-17 shortness of breath pneumonia; valley fever; diabetes; shortness of breath/difficulty breathing; body aches; headache; g... Read more
Close
pneumonia; valley fever; diabetes; shortness of breath/difficulty breathing; body aches; headache; got sick; hadn't been well enough; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This consumer (patient) reported for himself that a 49-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) at the age of 49-years, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 23Apr2021 at 02:11 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included he and his family did have the COVID-19 virus in Nov2020 (with the COVID-19 virus in Nov2020 his fever had reached 103 degrees Fahrenheit). Concomitant medications were not reported. He was calling about the vaccine. He was scheduled for his second dose on 14May2021 but between his first and second dose, he developed pneumonia. He reported he and his family did have the COVID-19 virus in Nov2020. He was the only one that got sick after receiving the vaccine. He didn't know if it was coincidental or happenstance. He had been taking medication and hadn't been well enough to get his second dose. His primary care doctor and the doctor he saw at the urgent care both told him not to get the second dose until he was well. Now several weeks had passed and he wanted to know if he was ok to get the second one or will he have to restart and get the first vaccine again. The type of pneumonia that he had was called Valley Fever. He had been told it was because of the dry climate. He did have a chest x-ray and that was who the doctor knew he had pneumonia. He also had a blood test to confirm that he had the Valley Fever. He also had a COVID-19 virus test and that was negative. He actually thought he had the COVID-19 virus for a second time. The symptoms were exactly like the COVID-19 virus. He had a low grade fever, body chills, body aches, a cough developed and a really intense headache. He went to the urgent care with those symptoms and tested him and found out he did have the Valley Fever, a type of pneumonia. The doctor ordered the blood test to confirm the Valley Fever. His fever didn't get as high this time like it did when he had the COVID-19 virus. This time with the Valley Fever his fever was about 100 degrees Fahrenheit. He definitely had body aches, chills, shortness of breath and difficulty breathing. Since Nov2020 when he had COVID-19 he can say his lung capacity wasn't what it used to be pre COVID-19 virus. He was just able to go out and walk his dog and felt like he was breathing normally. Then he received the first dose and a week and a half later he got sick with the Valley Fever. He would like to get the second COVID-19 vaccine but wanted to know if he had to start the process over. He didn't take any medications and considers himself healthy. He would like to add that when he went for his follow up for the Valley Fever he had a complete blood work and urinalysis and interestingly enough his numbers came back that now he was in the diabetic range. He didn't know if it was related to the COVID-19 vaccine or not but thought that he should add it. He wasn't prescribed any medications for the diabetes he was told to change his diet. His blood sugar came back normally and his doctor told him when people have diabetes their blood sugar gets out of whack. He was going to change his diet for the next couple months. He went to the urgent care on 14May2021 with his symptoms, that was the same day he was supposed to get the second COVID-19 vaccine. He was asking if he was outside the window and need to start over or just need to get another shot. He said that he wants to get the vaccine. The events shortness of breath, difficulty breathing result in physician office. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.
49 2021-07-17 shortness of breath redness; feeling very weak; he couldn't, his speech was because he was shivering so much that he cou... Read more
Close
redness; feeling very weak; he couldn't, his speech was because he was shivering so much that he couldn't fully speak; dry cough; his pupils dilate; gets bit of a blurred vision; Fever; sweats; chills; throbbing headaches; rash that looks like bruising spread over the body; fatigue; shortness of breath, he wasn't breathing fully; kind of look like bruises; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 49-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Solution for injection), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Right on 15Jun2021 17:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0161) as DOSE 1, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's Medical history was not reported. The patient's Concomitant medication included collagen (COLLAGEN) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. On 16Jun2021 17:30 patient experienced fever, sweats, chills, throbbing headaches, rash that looks like bruising spread over the body, fatigue, shortness of breath, he wasn't breathing fully, kind of look like bruises and On an unknown date patient experienced redness, feeling very weak, he couldn't, his speech was because he was shivering so much that he couldn't fully speak, dry cough, his pupils dilate, gets bit of a blurred vision. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood test: unknown result on 23Jun2021 "He underwent taking blood test on June 23". Patient was treated with "Antibiotics, tylenol, motrin" for the events fever, sweats, chills, throbbing headaches, rash that looks like bruising spread over the body, fatigue, shortness of breath, he wasn't breathing fully, kind of look like bruises, redness, feeling very weak, he couldn't, his speech was because he was shivering so much that he couldn't fully speak, dry cough, his pupils dilate, gets bit of a blurred vision. Patient experienced Fever, sweats, chills, throbbing headaches, rash that looks like bruising spread over the body, fatigue, difficulty breathing for 8 days, and some of the symptoms still ongoing past 8 days. Currently on 10th day. Symptoms started day after vaccine. Reporter stated, "If you are asking, is he suffering from medical condition, he did after taking the vaccine but before that he did not have any other medical condition". Reporter stated, "A week later, on June 23rd (not clarified) he went to see a doctor and he prescribed him antibiotics and before that he was taking Ibuprofen, he was taking Advil and then they told him not to take Ibuprofen but to take Tylenol and Motrin. So, since June 23 (not clarified) he has been taking Antibiotics, Tylenol and Motrin." (later clarified that patient was taking Antibiotics, Tylenol and Motrin as treatment). Reporter stated, "He underwent taking blood test on 23Jun." (not clarified further). Reporter stated, "So, he was taking Advil and then since 23Jun, he has been taking Antibiotics, Tylenol and Motrin". Reporter further stated, "He had severe headache and even when he took Advil sometimes it would not go away and it would get worse when he was just lying down and he would get headache that would come and go. He would wake up in the middle of the night sweating. He would have to (voice breaking) many times and then after that he would get chills and get very cold and he would shake, he was very cold. He had shortness of breath, he wasn't breathing fully and then on June 23rd (not clarified) which was a week later, he started having this rash all over the body and on his face specifically, they kind of look like bruises. So, when it was like pressed too long like when he had contact and it was pressed too long, it did developed redness and the redness is starting to go away, now it has gone away and he was feeling very weak and then he couldn't, his speech was because he was shivering so much that he couldn't fully speak and he was getting a little bit of dry cough. But mostly, it was the headache that would not stop and then yesterday, he is getting better and now, he is now able to breathe fully, he is able to walk around with more energy, he has less of a temperature fluctuations and but he still sweats at night but not as much and then sometimes he gets like his pupils dilate and he gets bit of a blurred vision but the shivers have gone away now". The outcome for the events "fever, sweats, chills, throbbing headaches, rash that looks like bruising spread over the body, fatigue, shortness of breath, he wasn't breathing fully, kind of look like bruises" was recovering and outcome for the events "redness, feeling very weak, he couldn't, his speech was because he was shivering so much that he couldn't fully speak, dry cough, his pupils dilate, gets bit of a blurred vision" was Unknown. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Shortness of breath; Upper and lower GI side effects; Slowed mentation; Daily severe headaches/Massive headache; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 49-years-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EW0175), dose 2 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 05Jun2021 12:00 (age at the vaccination 49-year-old) as DOSE 2, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation at Doctor's office/urgent care. Medical history included prior to vaccination the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot Number: EW0185), via an intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 15May2021 12:00 PM date as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced shortness of breath on 05Jun2021 12:45, daily severe headaches /massive headache on 05Jun2021 12:45, upper and lower gi side effects on 05Jun2021 12:45, slowed mentation on 05Jun2021 12:45. Every afternoon patient had massive headache which patient had never before, shortness of breath and had digestive problems every night, digestive problem like patient can have days of digestive problems upper GI and Lower GI. Adverse event (AE) required visit to the Physician Office. It was getting worst. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of daily severe headaches/massive headache. Patient took Motrin for headache. The outcome of the events was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association and profile of the product, a contribution from the suspect drug bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), to the event Dyspnea cannot be completely excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Shortness of breath on exertion; weakness; fatigue; chills; tingling sensation of extremities that continues on; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional, the patient. A 50-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot EK9231) solution for injection intramuscular on 21Dec2020 (at the age of 50-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 vaccination. Medical history included neuropathy. Concomitant medication included gabapentin. Past drug history included known allergies: TOPAMAX. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. On 27Dec2020, the patient experienced fatigue, chills, tingling sensation of extremities that continues on. Treatment for the events fatigue, chills, tingling sensation of extremities included ibuprofen (MOTRIN) and acetaminophen (TYLENOL) taken with minimal or short temporary relief. On 30Dec2020, the patient experienced shortness of breath on exertion and weakness and tried to go to Urgent care clinic for Covid test but no available test so the doctor prescribed ZITHROMAX in case it was Covid. On 30Dec2020, MRI, XRAY, LABS were taken and all came back negative and normal except having all these symptoms. On 02Jan2021, Covid test done and result was negative, tested for antibody and it was positive. The outcome of the event fatigue was unknown. The outcome of the events chills and tingling sensation of extremities was recovered in Jan2021. The outcome of the events shortness of breath on exertion and weakness was not recovered. The events fatigue, chills, tingling sensation of extremities that continues on, shortness of breath on exertion and weakness required a physician office visit.

Close
Date these symptoms started was 1/27/2021: About 12 hours after injection, developed fatigue and slight nausea as expected. Oral temperature 98.0. Commuted to work without issue. ~ 1400: As day progressed, nausea subsided, but fatigue grew more profound and developed pain in the right subscapular area with exertional shortness of breath walking any length of time. (Injection of initial and second doses were both in right deltoid). 1540 - 1800: Fatigue increased, developed a burning/tearing pain with every yawn and deep breath from the top of my trachea into both left and right mainstem bronchi and radiated to right arm. It literally felt like someone was trying to tear out my bronchial tree with each breath. 1800: Arrived home and medicated self-medicated with Motrin 400mg. 1800 -2030: rested at home with still some breathing pain, no shortness of breath, but incredibly tired. 2045: Went to bed and slept for the next 12.5 hours without any issued during the night. 0800: Woke up nearly all symptoms were gone, only some minor residual fatigue. No breathing pain, no nausea, no subscapular pain. I did not seek medical attention for symptoms, nor did I contact my provider. I experienced fatigue and a headache with the first dose, but no other symptoms. I never experienced fever or chills

50 2021-03-07 asthma allergies; allergy induced asthma; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patien... Read more
Close
allergies; allergy induced asthma; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). This physician reported similar events for 2 patients. This is the first of two reports. A 50-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number and expiry date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 22Jan2021 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included HTN (hypertension, Asthma, Allergies and allergy to penicillin. Concomitant medication included varicella zoster vaccine rge (SHINGRIX), olmesartan (OLMESARTAN), nebivolol hydrochloride (BYSTOLIC), hydrochlorothiazide and triamterene (MAXZIDE). It started several days after the vaccine. Patient have allergies and allergy induced asthma on 25Jan2021. It started slowly and became worse. Patient had to take allergy pills and double his steroid inhalent. Its the middle of winter and this never happens. No treatment was received. Outcome of the events was not recovered. The reporter considered the events non-serious. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021125841 Same reporter/product/event, different patient

Got first pfizer vaccine 3-12-21. Developed SOB after about 10 minutes which resolved with albuterol when got to car. 1/5. to 2 hours later developed dry mouth. Water couldn't produce saliva. Was still able to eat/smell/taste food. That lasted a day. The following day the metallic taste went just to the right side for a day. Since then occasionally gets a paresthesia around his lip/cheek area.11 days still getting metallic taste sensation for 5-15 minutes at a time
50 2021-03-23 shortness of breath Every since getting my vaccine I have been having these symptoms. I received my first dose of phize... Read more
Close
Every since getting my vaccine I have been having these symptoms. I received my first dose of phizer on 1/22/21 and a second dose 21 days later but was given Moderna not phizer. I continue to have headaches on and off all day, they are short but intense lasting about 5-10 minutes, sometimes hour or two between. Also shortness of breath and increased heart rate with just slight activity. Going up a flight of stairs my heart rate will quickly increase to 130-140 BPM which has never happened before. I have a fitness tracker on my watch so I watch it closely every day and it was never that high. My heart rate will recover fairly quick if I sit and it will come down to 80-90 BPM, at night when relaxed for a while the lowest I see it is about 70-75 BPM, sleeping it will be around 65 bpm.

pulmonary embolism; shortness of breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot ep7534), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 16Mar2021 15:00 as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included high blood pressure. Concomitant medication included verapamil. The patient previously took lisinopril and experienced allergies. The patient received first dose of bnt162b2 on 23Feb2021, 13:00 for Covid-19 immunization. On 19Mar2021, the patient started having challenges with shortness of breath. On 31Mar2021, after the challenge continued to grow he was checked into the hospital and was diagnosed with pulmonary embolism. Despite no travel nor history of family blood clots, nor was he was genetically dispositioned. The events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. Therapy for the events included Blood thinner. The patient had no other vaccine in 4 weeks, and no Covid prior vaccination. The patient was Covid tested post vaccination. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included nasal swab was negative on 31Mar2021. Outcome of events was recovering.

Presented to ED today with complaint of right-sided CP onset yesterday. Patient has history of renal cell carcinoma with metastatic disease to the liver. He has had recurrent pleural effusions involving the right lung. Has worsened pain with breathing. Had a R tube placed due to pleural effusion and last week when the tape was taken off it pulled and caused pain. Endorses SOB. No significant cardiac history. No h/o DVT, PE. Has renal CA and had L kidney removed. Patient admitted. Pulmonary/critical care was consulted regarding Pleurx catheter. It is felt that his pleural effusion had decreased in size, and the catheter was likely contributing to his right-sided pleuritic chest pain. Catheter is removed with good results of his pain. Patient however did have recurrent fevers. Empirically placed on Rocephin. With this, he did improve. He was discharged in stable condition.

50 2021-06-07 shortness of breath BPPV; burning sensation; partial loss of hearing; fullness and burning sensation in ears; tinnitus; ... Read more
Close
BPPV; burning sensation; partial loss of hearing; fullness and burning sensation in ears; tinnitus; brain fog; pressure in the back of my head; severe vomiting; shortness of breath; Pyrexia; Mental status changes; This is spontaneous report from contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 21Apr2021 14:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EWO161), at the age of 50 years, as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Previously the patient received first dose of bnt162b2 on 30Mar2021, at the age of 50 years, Time: 03:45 PM, Lot no. EW8730, anatomical location: Left arm. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. On 30Apr2021 19:30 the patient experienced Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV) (hospitalization, life threatening). On 30Apr2021 19:30 the patient experienced fullness and burning sensation in ears, tinnitus, brain fog, pressure in the back of head, severe vomiting, shortness of breath, pyrexia, mental status changes. On 12May2021 the patient experienced partial loss of hearing. On 28May2021 the patient experienced burning sensation. Clinical course: Nine days after taking a second dose of the Pfizer vaccine it started with multiple episodes of vertigo for 2 days, followed by severe vomiting, non-stop vertigo, shortness of breath. Taken into Emergency Room (ER) by ambulance on 02May2021, multiple tests performed (CT scan, blood, EKG) diagnosed with BPPV. Discharged the same night. The symptoms escalated into fullness and burning sensation in ears, partial loss of hearing, tinnitus, brain fog, pressure in the back of my head. Went to primary care physician on 05Jun2021, again multiple tests (blood, urine, EKG). Referred to ENT. Visited ENT on 12May2021, audiology test confirmed partial hearing loss. On 28May2021 the patient was still suffering with burning sensation and fullness in the right ear, as well as loss of hearing (high frequencies) and tinnitus. Periodic episodes of brain fog and severe vertigo. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood test: diagnosed with BPPV on 02May2021, blood test: unknown results on 06May2021, CT scan: diagnosed with BPPV on 02May2021, electrocardiogram: diagnosed with BPPV on 02May2021, electrocardiogram: unknown results on 06May2021, audiology test: partial hearing loss on 12May2021, urine output: unknown results on 06May2021. The patient received treatments due to the events: Diazepam, Meclizine, Potassium Chloride, Metoclop. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

A 50-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number: EM9810, Expiration date: unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, administered at an unspecified anatomical location on 10Feb2021 at 09:00 am (age at vaccination was 50 years) as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma. The patient had known allergies to iodine, shrimp and iodide (like the CATSCAN contrast fluid). Prior to vaccination, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications included colecalciferol (VITAMIN D [COLECALCIFEROL]) and One-A-Day Mens over 50 vitamin. The patient previously received first dose of flu shot in upper right arm on 12Jan2021. The facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered was Hospital. On 10Feb2021 at 15:00 pm, the patient experienced swelling of tongue, face, confusion, slurry words, difficulty breathing, no pains though, headache (bad one) and numbness in right side. The patient underwent Nasal Swab COVID test (COVID Nasal/Nasopharynx COVID test) on 28Feb2021 and the result was negative. The outcome of the events was resolved on an unknown date in 2021. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on a positive temporal association, a possible contributory role of the suspect BNT162B2 cannot be excluded for the reported events. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Chest pain; Shortness of breath/could not breathe while sweating profusely; Shortness of breath/could not breathe while sweating profusely; He turned white as a ghost; The patient all of the sudden didn't feel right; troponin was elevated; The patient's blood pressure has never been high but it was high when he got to the hospital; The doctors are leaning more toward myocardiopathy; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (wife of the patient). A 50-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: ER8737; Expiration Date: 31Jul2021), via intramuscular route of administration, administered in left arm on 31Mar2021, as dose 2, single (age at vaccination: 50 years), for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included type 2 diabetes mellitus which was diagnosed about 3-4 years ago and sleep apnoea which was diagnosed about 10 years ago and the patient sees a lung doctor for this yearly and uses CPAP machine (both are unknown whether ongoing or not) and the patient has never smoked or done drugs. The patient did not administer any vaccinations within four weeks prior or on same date of the Pfizer Suspect. There was no family medical history relevant to adverse events. The patient concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6206, expiration date 30Jun2021) on 10Mar2021, administered on right arm muscle as dose 1 single, (age at vaccination: 50 years), for covid-19 immunization and had no adverse effect. Patient's wife said that nothing like this has happened in the past. The patient was sitting at the kitchen table at about 5:30 pm and it was about an hour since they ate. The patient all of the sudden didn't feel right, couldn't breathe, was having chest pains, and was white as a ghost, started sweating profusely. The reporter and the patient got in the car and went to the hospital and they did a cardiac work up on him, they gave him nitro paste on his chest and was hospitalized or admitted because of the events. All the symptoms started at the same time. On 26Jun2021, they did an electrocardiogram/EKG which was fine (normal) but the patient's troponin was elevated. They transferred the patient to another hospital. The patient had a stress test on 27Jun2021, which was normal (They took pictures of the patient's heart during the stress test). Reportedly, the patient's blood pressure had never been high but it was high when he got to the hospital. The patient is not back to normal but was not complaining of anything. They put the patient on a heparin drip at the hospital for the troponin levels. The doctors are leaning more toward myocardiopathy and think it was related to the vaccine. The hospitalization duration was of 2 days, i.e., from 26Jun2021 to 27Jun2021. The patient was going to see a cardiologist on Tuesday. The outcome of the events: The doctors are leaning more toward myocardiopathy, blood pressure has never been high but it was high when he got to the hospital and troponin was elevated reported as unknown and the outcome was assessed as resolving for rest of the events. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Fatigue and headache in first 24 hours followed by a tightness in my chest and shortness of breath; Fatigue and headache in first 24 hours followed by a tightness in my chest and shortness of breath; Fatigue and headache in first 24 hours followed by a tightness in my chest and shortness of breath; Fatigue and headache in first 24 hours followed by a tightness in my chest and shortness of breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCIN), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 17Mar2021 at 15:45 (at 50 years old) as Single dose for COVID-19 immunization. There were no other vaccinations within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of BNT162B2. There were no medical history and concomitant medications. The patient had no known allergies. The patient did not have COVID prior to vaccination. The patient was not tested for COVID post vaccination. The patient experienced fatigue and headache in first 24 hours followed by a tightness in my chest and shortness of breath which continued from 19Mar2021 to 30Mar2021. Start date of the events was reported as on 17Mar2021 at 18:00. No treatment received for the events. Outcome of the events was not recovered. Information about Lot/Batch number was requested.

50 2021-07-28 throat tightness, shortness of breath Immediately after receiving the injection, I felt pain/sore that traveled from the injection site, w... Read more
Close
Immediately after receiving the injection, I felt pain/sore that traveled from the injection site, went through and across my left pectoral and ended at center of my chest/heart area. I waited 15 minutes in the observation area to see if symptoms would get worse, but they did not; and so I left the facility and drove home. On my way home, about 45 minutes after receiving the shot, I felt my throat tightening up a bit, and my left hand and eyelids began to cramp up. I stopped at a pharmacy and bought some Benadryl. After 30 minutes, the pain in my chest began to feel better, and the cramping had disappeared. At about 6 pm that same day, my chest pain returned; and so I took one more Benadryl. The pain/soreness began to disappear after about 30 minutes. I felt fine for exactly two weeks. On Thursday, April 1st, I woke up with severe abdominal pain, diarrhea, and constant vomiting for about 12 hours. Went to urgent care and received an anti-nausea shot. The vomiting stopped, but the abdominal pain continued until the next morning. The weekend of April 10th, I experienced the chest pain again. This time it was very concerning because I felt very lightheaded, short of breath and faint. I checked myself into ER two days after.

51 2021-01-02 throat tightness 11 minutes after vaccine administration I began experiencing prickling sensation of mouth lips follo... Read more
Close
11 minutes after vaccine administration I began experiencing prickling sensation of mouth lips followed by prickling sensation of my tongue, increased heart rate and for a few seconds felt my throat tightening. Symptoms lasted a few minutes. By the time I was evaluated at the emergency department a few minutes later I was feeling much better. I did not need to take any medications. 7 hours later I began experiencing itching all over my body however, I never developed a rash. My heart rate slightly increased. Simply did not feel well. Symptoms lasted a few minutes and again resolved without having to take any medications.

51 2021-01-25 throat tightness Dose 1 -Muscle twitched on injection into R deltoid. Immediately after injection experienced warm a... Read more
Close
Dose 1 -Muscle twitched on injection into R deltoid. Immediately after injection experienced warm and cold sensations through right arm, intermittent pains along arm. Was asked to be observed 30 mins post injection. Sent home. Paresthesias (intermittent warm, cold, tingling sensations) continued with radiation into right axillary, and into neck. Experienced intermittent facial tingling. On day 3 post injection, started with burning eye discomfort in right eye. Went to eye doctor to rule out eye infection. No eye infection, Instructed to use Refresh drops. In 4 days subsided. Day 7 experienced ear flushing and warmth that last 3 days and subsided. Saw a neurologist to rule out nerve damage. EMG was normal. ANA titer was 1:40 with speckled and cytoplasma pattern. My last ANA was negative when tested for inflammation due to back pain few years prior. Neurologist did not think this was an allergic reaction and since symptoms were gradually improving recommended second dose. Symptoms fully resolved after 2 weeks Dose 2 - Jan 19 , 2021 (21 days post) - Decided to inject left deltoid to avoid trauma to right arm. Was observed 30 mins and released. No symptoms. Moderate arm soreness x 4 days. Day 3 post injection developed burning eye discomfort, intermittent tingling sensation in arm, warm/cold sensations. Pain radiating to shoulder and neck. Day 6 started very mild tingling and warm sensations in in cheek and chin area. Also experienced intermittent prickly sensations in throat and sensation of throat tightness predominantly on left side. (but no actual swelling). Today (Jan 26, 2021) is Day 7 and these intermittent sensations are persisting. Arm soreness has resolved. Right eye burning discomfort improving.
51 2021-01-29 respiration abnormal, shortness of breath Began with a slight headache that eventually got worse. Started, when treated, at a 5 of 10. Left ... Read more
Close
Began with a slight headache that eventually got worse. Started, when treated, at a 5 of 10. Left facility with a 7 of 10 headache. Then I had a weird taste in my mouth (metallic like). My tongue started to tingle and was a bit numb. Eventually after Doctor at facility took me in, I was given benedryl 50 mg and an antacid. After a few minutes the right side of my mouth became itchy but the tingling stopped. The itch was not unbearable but it was getting there. I was already having a slight difficulty breathing but that was from the morning even with inhalers. As an instrument player a doctor said I have super lungs so my results would be skewed due to how much air I take in. But any loss of air, although in the safe range for others, is like breathing through a straw for me. My blood pressure was 139/90 at the time. My normal blood pressure is 117/70. I went home feeling cold and just not feeling well, relatable to flu symptoms. This is the next day after taking benedryl every 6 hours at 50mg/dose. My breathing is slightly labored. I feel ok but my arm hurts, I have been moving it around a lot just to get it mobile. My chest feels like there is a slight weight on it which is weird for me. At the moment my pulse is 81bpm and my oxygen is at around 96. My norm is around 70bpm and oxygen at 99. No temperature is consistent at 97.3. I feel a little weird today. I am stiff all over as well. Little aches here and there but that is a norm. Doing my stretches and exercise is not a go today. Can't breathe as normal.

Close
The night after receiving the second dose of the Pfizer Covid , the patient developed severe headache, who body myalgias, severe fatigue, and fevers. The next day he also developed pleuritic chest pain and shortness of breath. He described the chest pain as like a heart burning sensation, worse lying down and better sitting up. He documented a fever to 100.8 deg F. By the thord day the fever had resolved but the chest pain persisted, leading him to present to the emergency department. On exam he had BP 113/84, HR 95, RR 18, O2Sat 95% on RA, Temp 97.5 F. His lungs were clear to auscultation. Heart was RRR, S1, S2 WNL without MGR. ABD was soft, without tenderness, masses or HSM.

51 2021-03-23 shortness of breath Progress Notes 3/24/2021 Date: 3/24/2021 ... Read more
Close
Progress Notes 3/24/2021 Date: 3/24/2021 Subjective Patient is a 51 y.o. male who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for his first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. He was given the Pfizer vaccination in the right deltoid muscle. During his 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience "funny feeling in his face" and difficulties breathing. He denied rash, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, throat tightness, dizziness and facial swelling. This provider was notified of patient reaction and he was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to rapid progression of symptoms, respiratory distress and skin changes. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient denies chills, fever, facial swelling, cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath, wheezing, dizziness and headaches Previous Reactions: Denies. Objective Vitals Vitals: 03/24/21 0825 BP: (!) 132/90 Pulse: 89 SpO2: 100% Physical Exam Vitals reviewed. Constitutional: Appearance: Normal appearance. HENT: Head: Normocephalic and atraumatic. Mouth/Throat: Mouth: Mucous membranes are moist. Pharynx: Oropharynx is clear. No posterior oropharyngeal erythema. Comments: No swelling or lips or tongue. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. No respiratory distress. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. No wheezing or rales. Skin: General: Skin is warm and dry. Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: He is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: antihistamines, water and snacks Follow up response to treatment: good. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Differential Diagnosis: Vaccine-Related Anxiety (include misc mental health) and Systemic reaction (hypoglycemia, hypotension, generalized rash) 3/24/2021 9:12 AM

51 2021-03-24 rapid breathing, shortness of breath The patient is a 51 yo old reservist with a history of hypercholesterolemia with an onset of illn... Read more
Close
The patient is a 51 yo old reservist with a history of hypercholesterolemia with an onset of illness 10 days after Pfizer vaccine (lot #2 ELI283) on 6 JAN 2021, where he was on 87 day active duty orders with Medical Task Force - COVID mission. He denies any AE after dose #1 (Dec 17 lot #ELD140). He denies any immediate symptoms suggesting IgE event(pruritis, urticaria, SOB, wheezing, oral, facial throat, tongue swelling etc.) and denies any local site reaction. He reports about 10 days later he experienced severe nausea vomiting and diarrhea, CP and SOB. He was seen in ER 3 times where he was found to have Acute Kidney injury, and treated with IVF, odansetron meclizine dicyclimine. After the third ER visit he was admitted where he subsequently developed GI pain. He has continued to have significant health issues, but no unifying diagnosis has been identified. He would like to know if this was related to his Covid vaccine receipt. He reports no one else in his group will ill and they were otherwise isolated for travel related Covid quarantine. Per review of records he presented to ER 17 JAN 2021 (day 11) with complaints of nausea global weakness, watery diarrhea, and shortness of breath . He had a acute kidney injury with cr 1.4. A non contrast ABD CT was normal. He was diagnosed with viral gastroenteritis, treated with hydration, Zofran and Bentyl. He returned to ER 19 JAN (day 13) with a complaint of same with severe dizziness. A noncontrast head CT was normal He had a positive Dix-Hallpike and he was diagnosed with benign positional vertigo. On 1/20/21 (day 23) he continued symptoms with tachypnea on minimal exertion noted in ER. CXR demonstrated lateral RLL opacity and he was treated with Rocephin and azithromycin. He developed vague abdominal pain and was transferred to MTF. 26 JAN 21 GASTROENTEROLOGY: EGD - 'marked chronic active gastritis' - blood, stool sample and gastric biopsies are negative for H pylori infection - Protonix 40mg BID CT of kidney showed cyst on the left and nonobstructive 3mm stone and creatinine on is 0.9 (0.7-1.2).

Shortness of breath. Extreme night sweats. Unusual impotence. All started 10 day after injection. The outcome of the events was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: The company does not attribute the unusual impotence (PT: Erectile dysfunction) to BNT162b2, considering the event being an intercurrent disorder. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Blood Clot/The Blood clot was in the legs and went to his lungs; Blood Clot/The Blood clot was in the legs and went to his lungs; fell; Leg pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 51-year-old male patient received his first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 27Mar2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EP6955) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included thrombosis from 2020 to an unknown date, it was Months ago in 2020, He was prescribed a medicine for blood clots, but since then he has had no issues, anxiety from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. Her brother in law had anxiety about even getting the vaccine. The patient experienced leg pain on Mar2021 , pulmonary thrombosis, leg thrombosis and fall on an unspecified date. The patient died on 02Apr2021. An autopsy was not performed. The clinical course was the following: The Blood clot was in the legs and went to his lungs, his leg never got red or anything and it was a blood clot. He was having such bad leg pain, it's too bad, had there been some sort of warning, he would have thought to wait till next year. There was nothing the day he got vaccine, but that night his leg started hurting, his girlfriend said let me go get a cold wrap and she wrapped it, he's a farmer. He wakes up the next day and his leg is still hurting, the 3rd day it goes on, his leg still hurting and no one is thinking it a blood clot, he calls the doctor and tells the doctor his leg is hurting, they suggest ibuprofen for inflammation, the next day thought maybe it's better, by Friday he was making breakfast, fell and died. With his girlfriend she said what's going on, and he went straight to hospital, they said the clot in his leg went to the lung. The Blood clot when it was in the leg it never got hot, red, or anything like that. He had the vaccine in the morning and on that same day the leg pain started later that night. It Started out with Leg Pain, she does not know if it was right or left but it was just one leg.; Reported Cause(s) of Death: Thrombosis pulmonary; Thrombosis leg; Fall; Leg pain

BRIEF OVERVIEW: Bilateral PE Discharge Provider: MD Primary Care Provider at Discharge: NP Admission Date: 4/26/2021 Discharge Date: 4/26/2021 Active Hospital Problems (Diagnosis Date Noted) ? Pulmonary embolism without acute cor pulmonale, unspecified chronicity, unspecified pulmonary embolism type (HCC) 04/26/2021 Resolved Hospital Problems No resolved problems to display. CONSULTS: None INPATIENT PROCEDURES: None DETAILS OF HOSPITAL STAY: Patient is a 51 y.o. male with a past medical history of psoriasis, environmental allergies who presents today with sudden shortness of breath, left side pleuritic chest pain 7/10, worsened with deep inspiration. No recent travel, no family history, no history of malignancies, no immobilization or surgeries. He had his 2nd dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine on April 1. He does not have a history of COVID-19 infection, and COVID-19 PCR test was negative in ER. His blood pressure is a little high at 170 6/83 mm, pulse 76 per minute saturating 96% on room air, troponin less than 6, BNP 16, WBC 12.3,, EKG without any significant ST T-wave changes. CT angiogram of the chest shows nonocclusive thrombi in almost all the lobes, there is no saddle embolus noted. There is no evidence of right heart strain. Echo: The technical quality of the exam was limited due to suboptimal acoustic windows. The left ventricle is normal in size. There is normal left ventricular wall thickness. The left ventricular ejection fraction is 60%. Regional wall motion abnormalities cannot be excluded due to limited visualization. The right ventricular size, thickness, and function are normal. No significant valvular pathology identified with Doppler examination. There was insufficient tricuspid regurgitation envelope detected to calculate right ventricular systolic pressure. Injection of contrast documented no interatrial shunt. There is no comparison study available. He was started on Heparin gtt. And admitted for observation. He required no supplemental oxygen. He was discharged later pm on Eliquis 10 mg bid for 7 days, than 5 mg bid for 3 months. I am questioning did he had COVID-19 vaccine related bilateral PE. His hypercoagulable profile is pending. He has no sign of malignancy, no new symptoms, no weight loss. He had normal colonoscopy 2 yrs ago. He should follow up with his PCP. He was given work excuse from 4/26-5/3/21. She shouldn't take non steroidal anti-inflammatory (Ibuprofen (Motrin), Naproxen, Naprosyn, Voltaren, Relafen ... meds because of blood thinner Eliquis. He can take Tylenol 500 mg 1-2 tabs 3-4x a day as needed. He was also prescribed Lidoderm patch. For HTN he was started on DASH diet and Norvasc 5 mg daily. He should follow up with PCP next week. Also he was instructed to quit smoking.
